Steak and Bacon Salad

Salad Bacon Blue Cheese Chives Pork Lettuce Easy
Save (33)
Sign up to save this recipe to your profile Sign Up Now â€º
Rate
4 to 6 servings Easy
5.0 2
(2) Total: 30 mins Active: 20 mins
PREVIOUS: Bacon S'mores NEXT: Flank Steak and Arugula Salad

Ingredients (8)

  • 4 to 6 thick-cut slices bacon, coarsely chopped
  • 6 cups chopped romaine hearts
  • 2 cups chopped watercress and/or arugula
  • 1/2 cup Blue Cheese-Yogurt Dressing (see note), plus more for passing
  • 1 cup halved cherry tomatoes
  • Leftover grilled steak, thinly sliced
  • Chopped chives, for garnish
  • Crumbled blue cheese, for garnish
Nutritional Information
  • Calories192
  • Fat15.75g
  • Saturated fat5.51g
  • Trans fat0.05g
  • Carbs6.28g
  • Fiber2.17g
  • Sugar3.98g
  • Protein7.15g
  • Cholesterol27.91mg
  • Sodium264.59mg
  • Nutritional Analysis per serving (4 servings) Powered by

For this classic steak and bacon salad recipe, crispy bacon mingles with cold grilled steak, romaine hearts, watercress or arugula, crumbled blue cheese, and cherry tomatoes in creamy Blue Cheeseâ€“Yogurt Dressing.

by Kim Laidlaw

Instructions

  1. 1In a frying pan over medium heat, fry the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels.
  2. 2Place the salad greens in a wide, shallow salad bowl, drizzle with a little dressing, and toss to coat.
  3. 3Scatter with the bacon and tomatoes then top with the steak.
  4. 4Garnish with some of the chives and blue cheese. Serve, passing additional dressing on the side.
